p: A potential relationship or at least an epidemiological association [ 98] between viral infections and PD was first mentioned after the 1920–1930s influenza epidemic, which was associated with Encephalitis Lethargica (EL) [ 99]. The EL patients presented a type of ‘sleeping sickness’ which included uncontrollable sleepiness but also headache, nausea, fever, catatonia, and occasionally coma [ 100]. Compared to normal age-matched controls, PD patients have an elevated cerebrospinal fluid antibody response to coronaviruses [ 72]. Furthermore, reduction or blocking of the ER- to-Golgi trafficking leads to the accumulation of α-Synuclein [ 100] that contributes to ER stress as observed in PD disease model. Furthermore, Golgi fragmentation observed in PD results in reduced delivery of dopamine transporter [ 101] and impaired axonal synapses and dendrite trafficking. Interestingly, Golgi fragmentation was described in human neurons infected with MHV and SARS-CoV.
